Next to the slasher films of the 1970s and 80s, ones about the walking dead were probably the second most popular horror sub-genre in modern times. The success of George A. Romero’s 1968 Night of the Living Dead spawned the full-feature zombie craze in the 1970s, including popular theatrical classics such as The Living Dead at the Manchester Morgue, Zombie, Dawn of the Dead and The Return of the Living Dead.

The only reason I am commenting is because I finally figured out why Dr. Cox was bald. Although we probably all realized it at the same time this week Dr. Cox is bald because he has Raynaud's syndrome. If you look carefully every time he is disgusted, annoyed, or stressed you can see his finger tips go white. His reaction in The My Two Dads Episode perfectly depicted someone with Raynaud's syndrome.

The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with spikes with feeding tubes going all throughout the place and capturing the crew immediately, saving themselves. I saw it tonight and fell asleep in the movie.

That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in the theater..even the bad ones.

I felt my eyes closing and the people around me bobbing and weaving too. If I had woken up and found myself in the middle of the movie without anyone near me noticing me then I would have swear I had taken a shot.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by its external look, almost unreal as explained thanks to the colors. The biggest mistake to me is that : parody or not, this movie has taken a good literary character, prided of enough cult following, and made a worst version. The movie doesn’t have spirit and deserves no credit.

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film.
